intro: Galium wigginsii, commonly known as Wiggins' bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant features slender, ascending stems that are often covered with fine hairs. Its small, white flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom during the spring and summer months. Galium wigginsii typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks.
